meaningMnemonic: Think of someone holding out their hand at shoulder level. Anything above that equals "skillful." Everything below that equals "unskillful." So, in the case of this word, "below hand" means <vocabulary>unskillful</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Sometimes kanji have exceptional readings that are neither on’yomi, nor kun’yomi, and this is one of them. So here’s a mnemonic to help you remember this reading:

If you're <vocabulary>bad at</vocabulary> something and you complain about it, then you're just a <reading>hater</reading> (へた). Don't be a hater; get better.
